title: Calories in Boiled Shrimp
meta_description: Discover calories in boiled shrimp per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Medium-sized shrimp, peeled and deveined, boiled plain without added salt, butter, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, freshness, cooking time, and any added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of boiled shrimp provides ~99 kcal and ~24 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Boiled with 1/2 tsp salt per 100 g
Steamed instead of boiled (minimal water loss)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g boiled shrimp?
Is boiled shrimp high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 24 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean seafood option.

faqs.q: What about fat and carbs in boiled shrimp?
faqs.a: Very low: 0.3 g fat and 0.2 g carbs per 100 g.
Plain boiling adds none, but salted water can increase sodium beyond the natural 119 mg per 100 g.

faqs.q: How do calories change with shrimp size?
faqs.a: Larger shrimp may have slightly more calories per gram due to density, but values are similar across sizes when weighed.
